Posts.Title: help with fear..23 year old with lump lisa77 lisa77

Posts.Content: lisa77 wrote: My 23 year old daughter just showed me a small lump she found in her right breast about 2 inches above her nipple. It is about the size of 1/2 peanut and hard. I am so nervous. I know 80% are nothing, but it's that 20pct! I just wondered how common it is for a 23 year old with no children to have this lump be something. I read on line to maybe wait for a period cycle or 2 to see if it is related and will go away. What is the next step...an apt for a mamo or an ultra sound? Thanks for any advise! Posts.Content: Nov 8, 2007 04:06PM lisa77 wrote: Just wanted to follow up and ask another question. My daughter went into a breast center and had an ultrasound. He said he saw 2 very small cysts...not cancer. I wonder how he knew they were cysts and not cancer. They were only about the size of a small pea. He told her to stop taking the birth control pill and come back in 4 months to see if still there. She is engaged and does not want to chance stopping the pill. She would like to have kids in a few years, but not now. I am worried for her and wondered if taking one of those lower dose pills would make a diff. Anyone with experience with this and would you be nervous over cysts? Do they eventually become cancer? Thanks
